title: Tesla Set the Model for Selling EVs; Ford, VW and Others Want to Follow
sub_head: Traditional car companies desire more online orders and fixed pricing, while dealers see a threat to their role
body:
As car companies go electric, some are trying to wrest control from dealers on how those vehicles will be priced and sold, aiming to make the experience closer to the direct-selling model used by Tesla Inc.
Ford Motor Co. executives recently outlined plans for a system in which dealers wouldnâ€™t stock any EVs on their lots, but rather customers would place factory orders at a no-haggle price. The dealership is still involved but mostly to deliver the vehicle.
